intro: Conioselinum chinense subsp. boreale, commonly known as the northern Chinese wormseed, is a flowering plant native to northern China and adjacent regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its seeds are small and covered in fine hairs, which aid in wind dispersal, contributing to its ecological role in seed propagation.
